intro: Gnaphalium disynanthus, commonly known as the two-flowered everlasting, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellow disk flowers surrounded by pale green to white ray florets. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Gnaphalium disynanthus is known for its aromatic leaves and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
